page.title: 03ABERCAIRNEY ESTATE 2
page.content: They only farm animals such as sheep and cattle. At one time they had many horses and many grooms but now they only have one groom to look after 2 horses. The estate also buys pheasants which they release onto the estate and shoot. The shooting starts at the end of November, and for the grouse, the 12th of August. The laird's family, the{Drummond {Murrays,}have lived on the estate for over 100 years. In the woods there is a grave yard where all the lairds of the estate are buried, even a one day old child who was to be the laird. The "big house" is not the original, that was blown up. There is an old clock tower on the estate but it is now unsafe to go in to. Many of the buildings on the estate are very old and form an important part of our heritage.
